intro: Liabum eggersii, commonly known as the Eggers' grassvetch, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its small, pea-like flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Liabum eggersii is often found in sandy or gravelly areas and is adapted to dry, nutrient-poor conditions.
